What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain
Comments_List: Learn Spanish on a quicker but more immersive level
I strengthened my fluidity of the English language and also learned much more about Spanish grammar and culture.
I learned a lot more Spanish vocab and grammar- specifically grammar, and I improved a lot in my oral speaking.

This class was very good for focusing on grammar and developing listening and speaking skills. Went a little to quickly to truly grasp onto new vocabulary every chapter since we would do at least 2 every week.
My Spanish language fundamentals improved so much through this course. I also improved my speaking and argument construction abilities with the language.
I improved my ability to speak Spanish and learned many new verb tenses.
I learned advanced grammatical concepts along with vocabulary. This course was especially focused on improving speaking and listening skills which was a huge benefit.
I learned how to speak spanish, instead of the usual just practicing written grammer
I learned a lot of Spanish from vocabulary to grammar concepts, and got a lot of practice as well.

Strength: Is very immersive and it does lead to good learning of the language

Weakness: a lot of class time seems like busy work. Grades take too long to be put in. Takes time to realize improvement
Strengths: Made to easily facilitate student learning and was very engaging.

Strengths- great oral practice
Weaknesses- went a little fast (but that can't be helped because this is a summer course), wish there was more focus on vocab

Weakness: I think there needs to more consistency in grading methods between classes. I feel the other class consistently received higher grades and I wish grading had been more standardized for fairness. I also think grades for both classes should be released at the same time for both classes.

Strength: Very well organized, great opportunity, teachers and people are great
Weakness: Time flies by!

The strengths is the heavy emphasis on speaking so that students have an opportunity to practice all the time.

The only weakness I would say is that there is only one oral exam. I think if there was another one earlier, which doesn't have to be for a grade, this would give students more chances for feedback.

The strength of this course is the focus on speaking. I really feel like I learned how to use the language significantly better in four weeks. The weeknesses are the pace of the class and difficulty of some of the materials. We were assigned some readings that I feel I would have had trouble with in English. Also supersite is a waste of time and a significant amount of pure busy work. Another big weakness is the professors took FOREVER to grade anything. I'm literally taking like several weeks per quiz. It made it hard to know what needs to improve for next time.
I think it is great, i like practicing my speech

It would be nice if we could go to Spain a week earlier because it got a little boring in New Haven. Overall the course was very good, the frequent practice was helpful. A little more personal feedback on what I need to work on would've been helpful. There were on or two concepts that it would've been helpful to very quickly explain in English; I know that the point of the course is to use Spanish and practice it, but there were a few grammar concepts/questions that would've taken 30 seconds to explain in English, but took forever to explain in Spanish and still left confusion. I really enjoyed the course though.
Yes if you want to learn Spanish
Yes! Such a great way to learn another language. Highly recommend if you are able to dedicate your time.
Yes- great immersive Spanish class experience.
YES. This is the best way to study Spanish. You need to immerse yourself to fully understand the language and culture.
Yes. The opportunity to learn Spanish in an intensive manner allows you to learn the language much better and prepares you very well for study abroad.
Yes! Great opportunity to learn spanish and study abroad. Gets you a semester's worth of credits in two months!
I think it is much better to take this course over the summer if you have the opportunity to. Then you can focus just on the language and dive in completely.
Yes. This period over the summer is the investment period, but I felt more prepared to go to Spain after it.
I would recommend this course to someone who is dedicated to learning Spanish. I undoubtedly learned a lot but this program is Intense. The workload during the New Haven portion is crazy at times.
Yes. This program is amazing
Yes, it was a great experience and my Spanish definitely improved
